New York City is facing extreme cold conditions prompting Mayor Mamdani to announce warming shelters, while recent incidents include a tragic fire claiming two elderly lives and a three-alarm fire injuring two others, alongside ongoing public safety concerns and community responses to various crises.

### Risks & Alerts

- NYC deep freeze continues; single-room warming shelter units announced by Mayor Zohran Mamdani. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- 3-alarm fire injures two at a home in West Brighton, Staten Island. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Two elderly women killed in separate fires in Brooklyn and Queens within two hours. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMikgFBVV95cUxOa0huMnMtbVBfbl9RdWw4U3AwTUNBZ1FwNW9FYmZMaGNPN3pFZWJJb3JVSFQyZkx3YW5lMHNsUjRfUXNLMTZaZmZNX0FuNjZQX05yRVlDMlVzVFY0dmMxZUhrN2U4VWU4Z1lpNlJES2RobzdxVll2QWdvQnVXNFVDVzJMTFoxV1RYNDlOTlItMlB1Zw?oc=5)
- Melting snow and rock salt in Brooklyn causing power problems for hundreds of residents. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Cable falls from train track onto cars in Brooklyn; no injuries reported. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMimwFBVV95cUxPWnE5ZXlPelF2czFHY3lDSzBSbG1DcFA3TUFXMEEzdzhOTGlCLTVmaW02aUlrRkZKZWNCYWxrZU9Zd19yaC1vMG5aYjRJVVdicmZHeW1nM2pmNHctOW1PeXo0XzRpQV9QNzJkZk5XajhzMXB3NEE5Yk9jU0VfY0Y4cW9wRlFKMGRHaWZ1by1wMlBUSEdjVGdKS24xOA?oc=5)
